rating: 
-7
+
–
x


Item #:
 SCP-8107


Object Class:
 
Safe
 Euclid


Special Containment Procedures:
 Keep SCP-8107 in the storage locker of Low-Hazard Testing Lab 6 at Site-19. Dr Kingston is to maintain possession of the key to the locker.


Researchers must submit a written proposal for approval to Dr Kingston if they wish to test an unused bag. A verbal request is sufficient for testing with a pre-used bag, though destruction of any bag may result in loss of testing privileges.


As all the bags detached from the stack and used for testing (SCP-8107-2) are presumed to have the same anomalous effects as the unused bags (SCP-8107-1), further separation of unused bags is prohibited unless and until all used bags have been destroyed in the course of legitimate tests.


Investigation is to continue of Dollar General franchises across the country for any corresponding anomalous events, items, or persons.


Description:
 SCP-8107 consists of a total of 198 ‘T-Shirt’ style plastic shopping bags inside a cardboard box, 92 unused and still attached together in the standard fashion (SCP 8107-1) and 6 of them used in testing (SCP 8107-2). The markings on the cardboard box are typical for the boxes that shopping bags are shipped in, indicating an initial amount of 1,000 bags. The used bags have been flattened and replaced in the box for convenience. The bags are thin white plastic, identical visibly and materially to any other non-anomalous shopping bag. The printed slogan on each bag says 
VALUE MAX!!!
 in red letters, although the box was recovered from a Dollar General discount store. Efforts to locate additional bags are ongoing.


The box has no anomalous properties. The bags are reusable but no more durable than any other plastic bag, and the anomalous effect stops as soon as the body of the bag is ripped. Ripping the handles does not affect the anomaly itself but does make it slightly more difficult to activate.


Any item placed into the bag, then enclosed by compressing the top of the bag, either through twisting or squeezing, is immediately replaced with a significantly cheaper though semiotically similar item. If the replaced item is then enclosed again, the next replacement will be even more degraded in value, and items that are enclosed a third time are replaced with a crude and worthless approximation with no cash value whatsoever.


The chain terminates there: the anomaly removes but does not replace items with no cash
1
 value.








Test Log #1








Input


Black office stapler.
2






Output


Eight paperclips, tangled together.






Input


Paperclips.






Output


N/A






Special Note


The bag ripped around the paperclips as it was closed. When opened, the bag contained nothing and no longer functioned in an anomalous manner.












Test Log #4a








Input


Live white lab rat.






Output


Realistic black rubber rat, possibly a prank item or a Halloween decoration.






Input


Black rubber rat.






Output


Small, crude felt mouse, possibly a cat toy.






Input


Felt mouse.






Output


Crumpled ball of receipt paper, blank when unfolded.












Test Log #16








Input


GPS Vehicle Locator, Consumer Grade






Output


Broken rear-view car mirror, unknown make or model.






Special note:


GPS unit ceased transmission at moment of replacement.












Test Log # 20a








Input


Fresh American 100$ bill.






Output


Four American 20$ bills, crumpled and damp.






Input


Four 20$ bills.






Output


Single 20$ monopoly game bill, dirty and half-chewed.






Special note:


DNA testing of chewed edges inconclusive.






Input


Monopoly bill.






Output


Scrap of receipt paper with IOU written in blue ballpoint pen, handwriting very bad.






Input


Scrap IOU






Output


Nothing.










Test Log #20b








Input


One Euro €100 banknote.
3






Output


Nothing.












Test Log #39








Input


One pound package of raw hamburger.






Output


One pre-cooked hotdog, cold and damp.






Input


Hotdog






Output


Smear of grease on inside of bag.












Test Log #40a








Input


One pound of very fine filet mignon, pan-seared medium-rare with herb butter by a French chef, lowered into bag on an antique china plate.






Output


Large
4
5
6
7
 slice of cheese pizza, room temperature, with three paper napkins










Test Log # 40b








Input


One pound raw filet mignon, same quality as before.
8






Output


One pound raw hamburger in package. Inspection shows it to be the same hamburger as the previous test.






Special note:




This time the hamburger arrived frozen. Weird.
9








Input


Raw hamburger.






Output


Can of vienna sausages, dented.






Input


Sausages.






Output


Grease-spotted scrap of receipt paper, IOU handwritten with pen. Handwriting consistent.












Test Log #44








Input


Fresh apple, Red Delicious.






Output


Tattered perfume sample swatch, entitled ‘Autumn Secrets’






Input


Bunch of bananas (six of them)
10
11
12






Output


One yellow gumball.






Input


Three fresh apples, Fuji.






Output


Three cherry throat lozenges, one unwrapped and sticky.












Test Log #45








Input


Dr ███████’s wedding ring. Gold band set with three small rubies.
13
14






Special Note:


Dr ███████ is married to Dr Kingston.
15






Output


Watermelon-flavored ring pop.






Special Note:


Dr ███████ has a particular preference for artificial watermelon flavor, in case that's relevant to the proper testing procedures and documentation protocols that Dr Kingston loves so much.












Test Log #63








Input


Sheet of notebook paper with “Are you sapient?” written on it in blue ballpoint pen.






Output


Very small blank scrap of receipt paper, marked with an x.












Test Log #64








Input


Sheet of fine vellum with “Are you self-aware and/or intelligent?” ornately calligraphed in red ink.






Output


Larger scrap of receipt paper reading "no LOL I work here". Handwriting consistent.












Test Log # 65








Input


Traditionally hand-crafted parchment paper, intricately illuminated with hand-ground pigments and inks, bearing the message, “If you are a person or any other self-aware being, please respond with your name and location. We will find you and help you.”






Output


Small 3.5” x 4” spiral notebook, greasy on one corner. On the first page is written "gimme a raise HA HA :)" Handwriting consistent.












Test Log #66








Input


Same notebook as output from Test 65. Returned with "who are you?" written on the second page.






Output


Torn off piece of notebook paper crumpled into a small, damp ball. It proved to be blank when unfolded.












Test Log #67








Input


Unopened roll of receipt paper.






Output


Nothing.

 | SCP-8107 | 
SCP-8108
 »

Footnotes


1
. Specifically American cash.


2
. Please note for the record that this was not the first item ever tested with SCP 8107, but simply the first item to be tested at Site-19 under proper documentation protocols.


3
. Testing with a different input item 
should
 have warranted a new test number, not a subtest letter.


4
. Please specify such measurements in the future.


5
. It was bigger than a medium slice.


6
. Agents that cannot take even "Safe" SCPs seriously when testing will find their access to such items curtailed in the future.


7
. I don't know what to tell you other than it was a large slice of pizza. Go order a large slice of pizza and measure it. It was that big.


8
. Again, this series of tests should have been numbered by input type, not sub-lettered. Dr ███████ is recommended for retraining as to proper testing procedures and documentation protocols.


9
. Dr ███████ is requested to refrain from including such subjective assertions in test logs.


10
. We're going with fruit, here. It's connected. I hate wrestling with all this ███████ table code anyway.


11
. The formatting for this test log is completely incorrect. Please revise.


12
. You do it if it's that ███████ important.


13
. Diameter of ring: 17.2mm in diameter. Rubies: ~1mm across each. Diamond carats: unknown. Gold carats: probably 14 I don't know.


14
. It was 22 carat.


15
. Was.

title: SCP-8107
